intro: Hieracium phrixocomoides, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are generally lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
